Now, in a Globe exclusive, San Francisco Police Department has revealed that the iconic Target on Mission Street between Third and Fourth Streets will be shutting its doors before the end of the year.“This store loses $25,000 a day to shoplifting,” an SFPD officer told the Globe in lengthy, taped interviews conducted this week. “That’s $25,000 that walks out the door on average between 9 and 6 every day.”
with the fall/ winter holiday season people want stuff even more...pent up demand...

Interesting reading the comments below. I do think you have a great company but have you been in one of the stores lately? They try stretching out what inventory they have but they are under stocked just as Home Depot is and others that rely on imports. Look at the backlog at all the ports, not just in the US but in China. With energy prices going through the roof, and the shortages, retailers could have a very tough Christmas Season.

mf article is interesting..but there are a lot of people who want to buy this season...and there is pent up demand for comfort stuff..many of these people do not have credit cards, this opens the door for them...
went to 2 local Targets shelf were stuffed full lol supply chains my as!! lots were full outer suburbs lol
does the company goes up when there’s supply issue? i’m thinking about buying, any opinion will greatly appreciated

TGT has been navigating supply chain challenges for months, ordering larger quantities in advance and partnering with vendors to fast-track orders. Plus, their ending inventory at the end of Q2 was more than $2.5 billion, or 26% higher, than PY. They've even chartered their own container ships to avoid backed-up ports. Panic selling has caused a great opportunity to buy a great retailer at a discount price.
TGT is down because of BBBY. Possible supply chain issue.
Good fundamentals and great earnings & profits, why the downtrend?

Do not own Target stock and never will. I live less than a mile from a nice Target store, and I will never shop at Target again. They keep billing my Credit Card for 72 Cents after I made my last purchase, and they tell me it is a computer glitch, and they will get it fixed. In addition, the drive up delivery sucks. Walmart you drive up and call a number on the sign they bring your order right out. Target you have to use some Dam that doesn't work, so you have to wait and flag a passing employee. Crazy to own a stock like this. (Complaint Case # 121205668)
Best performing retailer next to Costco. Costco trading at 36X 2023 eps. TGT 18X. I don't think Costco is worth twice as much so I think TGT has room to move higher.
Lets go Brandon!

Is there a possibility that the mm’s are walking the stock back so TGT can accelerate their $15bb share buyback program and get the shares at lower prices? I’m surprised over the past few weeks to see the stock drop on pretty low volume. There’s been nothing I can find to justify the drop other than maybe this share buyback theory. In general, the buyback is a good thing so IMO it’s worth waiting this out. Thoughts?

Well, typical WS bull…batter a solid stock for weeks on end for no reason and when retail is stopped out or frustrated they run it up ten percent in a few sessions and then sell calls and upgrade. Easy $ for Wall Street. If you are long you can only buy and hold if you believe in the stock.
